messages.subject: Nanako
messages.msgSnippet: When viewing early shakudo (Ko) kogai (and kozuka/kogainaoshi) the older pieces tend to have a very fine, flattened nanako.  Does anyone have any information
messages.messageBody:
When viewing early shakudo (Ko) kogai (and kozuka/kogainaoshi) the
older pieces tend to have a very fine, flattened nanako. Does anyone
have any information on when this form of nanako transitioned into the
plumper form we more regularly see?
Thanks much!
Pete
